str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Of time: when, now, after that; of cause: seeing that, forasmuch as. From epei and de; since now, i.e. when, or whereas.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence. From sophos; wisdom.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Wisdom, insight, skill (human or divine), intelligence. From sophos; wisdom.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be well-pleased, think it good, be resolved. From eu and dokeo; to think well of, i.e. Approve; specially, to approbate.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Folly, absurdity, foolishness. From moros; silliness, i.e. Absurdity.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A proclamation, preaching. From kerusso; a proclamation.
To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
